body:
as said in the other issue, this seems to be a php issue which only manifests in the design, but not an issue with the design itself. are there no webserver logs?

cc @vicdeo @bantu

nginx's webserver logs won't be very usefull/are network logs, because nginx doesn't do the php-parsing (what's good imo).

#### network logs (nginx):
```
10.4.0.6 - - [30/jul/2013:18:06:43 +0200] "get /index.php/post-setup-check http/1.1" 200 1172 "-" "mozilla/5.0 (x11; linux x86_64) applewebkit/537.36 (khtml, like gecko) chrome/30.0.1575.0 safari/537.36 suse/30.0.1575.0"
```

syslog, where php-fpm is supposed to write logs in, doesn't contain anything related.

@kondou-ger does this error still occur?

also cc @ringmaster @butonic do you know what the issue could be?
i don't see this happening on ubuntu 12.04 lts with php 5.5.  could it have been addressed by other fixes since the issue was reported?
doesn't happen anymore (at least now) – let's see if it stays this way
